Description: Fragment of neck from Attic black-figure painted pottery neck-amphora. Male head to right. Purple on fillet round hair; as a band at outer edge of top of lip and just inside lip; on necking ring.
Curator's comments: Cook dates the fragment to 570-560 BC while Venit (1982) dates it to 560-550 BC Possibly the work of the same artist who painted Oxford 1960.1290 (Boardman 1975, 1, pl. 1, 1-2), near Lydos, but not by Lydos (Schlotzhauer & Weber).
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B115.15)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 607, 1)
Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (pl. xxxi, 3)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 12)
